headerDisplay: The CEC TV Controls Platform plugin exposes an HDMI-connected and CEC-enabled device as a TV in Homebridge.  This lets you control various functions (such as power) in one convenient location.

name.title: Name
name.description: This name will be used to give the exposed TV object a default name in Homekit.

manufacturer.title: Manufacturer
manufacturer.description: This is the manufacturer of your TV.  This isn't required, but it will be added to the accessory information in Homekit.

model.title: Model
model.description: This is the model of your TV.  This isn't required, but it will be added to the accessory information in Homekit.

serialNumber.title: Serial Number
serialNumber.description: This is the serial number of your TV.  This isn't required, but it will be added to the accessory information in Homekit.

pollingInterval.title: Polling Interval
pollingInterval.description: The time (in milliseconds) to wait before polling the CEC device for its status.  For example, 2500 milliseconds is 2.5 seconds.  Polling too quickly may result in inaccurate results.

minimizeLogging.title: Minimize Logging
minimizeLogging.description: If unticked/disabled, information will be logged when device status is changed, or when it's polled for updates.  If ticked/enabled, these logs will be suppressed.  Warnings and errors will still be logged regardless of this setting.

inputs.title: HDMI Inputs (Beta)
inputs.description: A list of the HDMI inputs supported by your device.  Most TVs shouldn't let you switch to unused HDMI inputs (i.e. with nothing plugged in) so you only need to include inputs that are in-use (i.e. with something plugged into them).

inputNumber.title: Input Number
inputNumber.description: This is the input source number, i.e. if this is for HDMI 1 this should be 1.

displayName.title: Input Name
displayName.description: This is the name that will be exposed to Homekit (and shown in the input selector for the device).

useActiveSource.title: Use Active Source
useActiveSource.description: Active Source is a command sent to the TV that tries to notify it which input would like to be marked 'active'.  Depending on your TV, this might not work as intended due to the TV refusing Active Source commands issued from other devices. If enabled, an Active Source command will be issued when an input change is requested.

useInactiveSource.title: Use Inactive Source
useInactiveSource.description: Inactive Source is a command sent to the TV that notifies it that the current input is becoming 'inactive'.  Generally this is desired, but for some TVs it might be required to disable this if it causes issues.  If enabled, an Inactive Source command will be issued when an input change is requested.

useSourceRouting.title: Use Source Routing
useSourceRouting.description: Some TVs adopt the HDMI-CEC specifications in unusual ways.  Source Routing is another way to try and change TV Inputs.  If enabled, Source Routing will be used in addition to any other commands.

useSetStreamPath.title: Use Set Stream Path
useSetStreamPath.description: Some TVs adopt the HDMI-CEC specifications in unusual ways.  Set Stream Path is another way to try and change TV Inputs.  If enabled, Set Stream Path will be used in addition to any other commands.
